Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gnutls
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnutls bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The gnutls packages provide the GNU Transport Layer Security (GnuTLS) library, which implements cryptographic algorithms and protocols such as SSL, TLS, and DTLS. The gnutls packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.3.8, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version, including: Implementation of FIPS140-2 mode, a US Federal Information Processing Standard, which when activated provides the following capabilities: All cryptographic key material are be set to zero following every use. A DRBG (deterministic random generator) from NIST SP-800/90 (US National Institute of Standards and Technology) has been implemented to replace the default RNG (random number generator) in FIPS mode. Self tests for the DRBG have been implemented. All algorithms that are not needed in FIPS mode have been set to disabled. Key and DH generation parameters are now based on FIPS recommendations. (BZ#1110696) This update also fixes the following bug: Previously, when the certtool utility generated a PKCS #8 (Public Key Cryptography Standard (PKCS)) format private key with no password, an encrypted structure was generated with an empty password. This has been fixed and with this update unencrypted PKCS #8 format private keys will be generated as expected. (BZ#1084080) Users of gnutls are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
